note:
Retired, married, and has ADHD. Arctophile, sciencey stuff, computer/infosec, cooking, books of all formats and growing vegetables.

I learnt BASIC in 1977, and my first computer was an Acorn Atom on which I learnt to programme in Assembler. First proper IT job maintaining an old COBOL based mainframe application that first went live in 1971.

Woofian is an old demonym for my home town in Warwickshire. Now I live in North Kent.

I am also known as Great Uncle Zanzibar

Old, grumpy git. I don't eat Tofu, but am otherwise a fully paid up member of the 'Wokerati' so reviled by our Home Secretary.

I've been a student of Classical Guitar since retiring, and can now read music reasonably. I've played Acoustic Guitar, intermittently, for most of my adult life. I've also taken up the Mandolin in recent years. I'm studying Trad Irish and Bluegrass styles. And. Loving. It!
